question: 狩人
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>hunt</kanji> <kanji>person</kanji> is a person who hunts. A <vocabulary>hunter</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You learned the reading of <ja>狩</ja> when you learned the kanji, but the reading for <ja>人</ja> is totally irregular. Just imagine that you're hunting a reindeer named <reading>Rudo</reading>lph (<ja>りゅうど</ja>). He has an unusually red nose, which makes him easy to spot and puts him at a bit of a disadvantage.
